poem:
Bishop's Radiance  

Black, female, fearless—  
a rose blooming in the  
cold of tradition's hold—  
Jamaican roots reaching  
through the stained glass:  
an emblem of warmth, joy  
in a world bruised—  
her voice rises,  
a hymn against shadows,  
a beacon amid  
the unopened cards  
of a silent cathedral.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
